bug.author: jobvarkey
bug.description:
Trying to install Kubeflow v.70 on on-prem cluster (kubernetes v15.7/Ubuntu 18.04) but getting below error: root@0939-jdeml-m03:/opt/kubeflow/kf-test# kfctl apply -V -f ${CONFIG_FILE} INFO[0000] <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Notice anonymous usage reporting enabled using spartakus To disable it If you have already deployed it run the following commands: cd $(pwd) kubectl -n ${K8S_NAMESPACE} delete deploy -l app=spartakus For more info: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/usage-reporting/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/usage-reporting/</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
filename="coordinator/coordinator.go:120" INFO[0000] Deleting cachedir /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/.cache/manifests because Status.ReposCache is out of date filename="kfconfig/types.go:464" INFO[0000] Fetching <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz</denchmark-link> to /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/.cache/manifests filename="kfconfig/types.go:485" Error: failed to build kfApp from URI /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/kfctl_existing_arrikto.yaml: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: could not sync cache. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz</denchmark-link> Error Error opening a gzip reader for /tmp/getter093015857/archive: EOF Usage: kfctl apply -f ${CONFIG} [flags] Flags: -f, --file string Static config file to use. Can be either a local path: export CONFIG=./kfctl_gcp_iap.yaml or a URL: export CONFIG=<denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.0.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.0.yaml</denchmark-link>
export CONFIG=<denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_existing_arrikto.0.7.0.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_existing_arrikto.0.7.0.yaml</denchmark-link>
export CONFIG=<denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_aws.0.7.0.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_aws.0.7.0.yaml</denchmark-link>
export CONFIG=<denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.0.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.0.yaml</denchmark-link>
kfctl apply -V --file=${CONFIG} -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false failed to build kfApp from URI /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/kfctl_existing_arrikto.yaml: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: could not sync cache. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz</denchmark-link> Error Error opening a gzip reader for /tmp/getter093015857/archive: EOF The Kubeflow installation was working fin when tried it a few days ago. Trying to install it in a new cluster and getting this error. Can you please help? Thanks, Job Varkey

I am having this same issue which seems to have started some time today. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz Error Error opening a gzip reader for /tmp/getter291586024/archive: EOF Usage: kfctl build [flags]
Flags: -f, --file string Static config file to use. Can be either a local path: export CONFIG=./kfctl_gcp_iap.yaml or a URL: export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.0.yaml export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_existing_arrikto.0.7.0.yaml export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_aws.0.7.0.yaml export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.0.yaml kfctl build -V --file=${CONFIG} -h, --help help for build -V, --verbose verbose output default is false
failed to build kfApp from URI https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_aws.0.7.1.yaml: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: could not sync cache. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz Error Error opening a gzip reader for /tmp/getter291586024/archive: EOF </denchmark-code>

I am having the same issue. I even tried using kfctl_v0.7.1-2-g55f9b2a.

Hi, I tried to use my PR branch in the KFDef and got the same fail - specifically: <denchmark-code>uri: https://github.com/vpavlin/manifests/archive/openshift/kfdef.zip </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI https://github.com/vpavlin/manifests/archive/openshift/kfdef.zip Error zip: not a valid zip file </denchmark-code>
If I click the link the zip is downloaded normally and the contents seem to be ok

I tried to find how to get a tarball from github properly and found <denchmark-link:https://blog.abelotech.com/posts/how-download-github-tarball-using-curl-wget/>https://blog.abelotech.com/posts/how-download-github-tarball-using-curl-wget/</denchmark-link>
based on that I used: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vpavlin/manifests/tarball/openshift/kfdef>https://github.com/vpavlin/manifests/tarball/openshift/kfdef</denchmark-link>
And that passed, but it fails elswhere - probably because of the branch name (as it contains /) and there is a sub-dir created in .cache/manifests. So I don't see the above described issue anymore...sorry:) EDIT: But something is really fishy there, because the cache now contains one file which has the name of the branch and is empty (instead of a dir or content of the branch)
Same issue here with kfctl v0.7.0
Same here also with 0.7.0 and 0.7.1 Yesterday was working.
Any reason you can't use one of the compiled binaries in the Darwin and Linux tarballs?
When I did tar -xvf on the Linux tarball it did not create the kfctl executable.

<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4356289/72454003-acf2e900-3785-11ea-80c1-f1376f5e4dd9.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>wget https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/releases/download/v1.0-rc.1/kfctl_v1.0-rc.1-0-g963c787_darwin.tar.gz tar -xzvf kfctl_v1.0-rc.1-0-g963c787_darwin.tar.gz ./kfctl </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mukulp>@mukulp</denchmark-link> this works for the MacOS client. ^

I used <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/releases/tag/v1.0-rc.1>https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/releases/tag/v1.0-rc.1</denchmark-link> as the tarball. I did not know there was a tarball at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/releases/download/v1.0-rc.1/kfctl_v1.0-rc.1-0-g963c787_linux.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/releases/download/v1.0-rc.1/kfctl_v1.0-rc.1-0-g963c787_linux.tar.gz</denchmark-link> . Now I know how to build using go, I will experiment with the go language and see if I can make any sense of kfctl. At some point I need to test this on ubuntu 19 and k8s above version 1.15.7.

Hi guys,
Trying to install Kubeflow v.70 on on-prem cluster (kubernetes v15.7/Ubuntu 18.04) but getting below error: root@0939-jdeml-m03:/opt/kubeflow/kf-test# kfctl apply -V -f ${CONFIG_FILE} INFO[0000] Notice anonymous usage reporting enabled using spartakus To disable it If you have already deployed it run the following commands: cd $(pwd) kubectl -n ${K8S_NAMESPACE} delete deploy -l app=spartakus For more info: https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/usage-reporting/ filename="coordinator/coordinator.go:120" INFO[0000] Deleting cachedir /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/.cache/manifests because Status.ReposCache is out of date filename="kfconfig/types.go:464" INFO[0000] Fetching https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz to /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/.cache/manifests filename="kfconfig/types.go:485" Error: failed to build kfApp from URI /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/kfctl_existing_arrikto.yaml: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: could not sync cache. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz Error Error opening a gzip reader for /tmp/getter093015857/archive: EOF Usage: kfctl apply -f ${CONFIG} [flags] Flags: -f, --file string Static config file to use. Can be either a local path: export CONFIG=./kfctl_gcp_iap.yaml or a URL: export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.0.yaml export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_existing_arrikto.0.7.0.yaml export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_aws.0.7.0.yaml export CONFIG=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.0.yaml kfctl apply -V --file=${CONFIG} -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false failed to build kfApp from URI /opt/kubeflow/kf-test/kfctl_existing_arrikto.yaml: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: could not sync cache. Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz Error Error opening a gzip reader for /tmp/getter093015857/archive: EOF The Kubeflow installation was working fin when tried it a few days ago. Trying to install it in a new cluster and getting this error. Can you please help? Thanks, Job Varkey
Hi, I also met this error when I was trying to re-install the kubeflow, and here is my idea: You can first download this file via wget: wget <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz</denchmark-link>
And then unzip the file tar -xvf v0.7-branch.tar.gz I guess you're trying to install the kubeflow via this file: kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.1.yaml So after you open the file and scroll down to the end, you will find this information repos:
name: manifests uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz As the key point is "couldn't download URI https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.7-branch.tar.gz", why not we just switch the uri to the local path as we unzip the v0.7-branch.tar.gz file. => repos: name: manifests uri: /the path you unzip the file/v0.7-branch
And finally, try to run this command again: kfctl build -V -f kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.1.yaml That should work.
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/superkjp>@superkjp</denchmark-link> , I tried that solution and I remember there was some other issue that rise.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kishoreallwynraj>@kishoreallwynraj</denchmark-link>
I apologize that I miss the last step which is running: kfctl apply -V -f kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.1.yaml Because "kfctl build" will make sure kubeflow creates the series of kustomized folder that contains the necessary components it needs. So, try the command above again and let's see what happens. Here are two things I'd like to mention:
You may be stuck on the warning when your k8s is trying to create the 'cert-manager'. That's because the time it generates the pod: cert-manager-webhook takes some time, so just wait and it will take care of it. I cannot remember the name exactly but the statement is about missing one part of the components, just run the command: kfctl apply -V -f kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.1.yaml again.
Hope this helps you.
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/superkjp>@superkjp</denchmark-link> .. that worked.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sk1395>@sk1395</denchmark-link> , The relationship between the version of Kubeflow and Kubernetes is:
Kubernetes Versions Kubeflow 0.4 Kubeflow 0.5 Kubeflow 0.6 Kubeflow 0.7
1.11 compatible compatible incompatible incompatible
1.12 compatible compatible incompatible incompatible
1.13 compatible compatible incompatible incompatible
1.14 compatible compatible compatible compatible
1.15 incompatible compatible compatible compatible
1.16 incompatible incompatible incompatible incompatible
or check from here: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/overview/#minimum-system-requirements>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/overview/#minimum-system-requirements</denchmark-link>
I see the version of your k8s is 1.13.11, which illustrates that you can only choose the Kubeflow version 0.4 and 0.5. Before I upgrade my k8s version > 1,14, I also met the issue the same as yours. So here are two options:
Follow the installation from here: https://www.lightbend.com/blog/how-to-deploy-kubeflow-on-lightbend-platform-openshift-installing-kubeflow?_ga=2.218094358.1214307035.1579078664-404386627.1572258766 The author chose the Kubeflow version v0.4.1 and it works(version could be old and no user isolation supported). Upgrade your k8s version > 14.0 and try to install Kubeflow > 0.7.0
As the issue: you cannot get access to the central dashboard, that's because the Kubeflow works with istio. The central dashboard cannot be accessed directly with the port-forwarding with the centrol-dashboard pod/svc. Instead, you should do with this: kubectl port-forward svc/istio-ingressgateway -n istio-system 8080:80

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/superkjp>@superkjp</denchmark-link>
I was trying to install kubeflow-0.7.0 on openshift-4.2.0. I tried to follow all the steps that you mentioned in the comments and I could able to build successfully but I am seeing the below snapshot error after running this command from 8-10 mins. I tried to repeat the steps that you mentioned for thrice but still sees the same error. Do you have any recommendations on this? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43678538/78302249-073b5480-7500-11ea-849e-296eddd48666.PNG></denchmark-link>

Hello, Looks like you tried to install it for the first time and it failed, so you want to do it again. But you didn't clean all the things up.
So here is the way you can do as a reference. 1.. clean up the crd related with istio: kubectl get crd -n istio-system | grep 'istio'|awk '{print $1}' |xargs kubectl delete crd -n istio-system
2. clean up the namespace that related to the Kubeflow: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/thyarles/knsk>https://github.com/thyarles/knsk</denchmark-link>
Here you can use the kubernetes namespace killer, just run knsk.sh --delete-all The reason why you cannot delete the namespace is mainly that something wrong happened with the broken apiservice.
And try to run: kfctl apply -V -f ./kfctl_k8s_istio.0.7.1.yaml to see whether it works.
